error.message: A method of '%t' was invoked on an incompatible object.
error.description: You tried to call a method that is not available to the specified object.This error occurs when you have copied a prototype function from one object to another, and then invoked it, but the target object is not the same type as the original object. Ensure that the target object and original object are the same type. See ECMAScript edition 3 chapter 15 for more details.

error.description: ExternalInterface requires Internet Explorer ActiveX, Firefox, Mozilla 1.7.5 and greater, or other browsers that support NPRuntime.

The FileReference.download() file name contains prohibited characters.
error.description: The filename cannot contain spaces or any of the following characters: /, \, :, *, ?, ", <, >, |, %, or the ASCII control characters 0 through 31 (0x00 through 0X1F). Also, filenames longer than 256 characters may fail on some browsers or servers.

error.description: The recursion exceeds the maximum recursion depth. (The default maximum is 256.)

error.description: There are two valid formats: A description with Windows file extensions only A description with Windows file extensions and Macintosh file formats. The two file formats and not interchangeable; you must use one or the other. For more information, see the FileFilter class in this language reference.

A SQLConnection cannot be closed while statements are still executing.
Database connection is already open.
Name argument specified was invalid. It must not be null or empty.
Operation cannot be performed while there is an open transaction on this connection.
A SQLConnection must be open to perform this operation.
Operation is only allowed if a connection has an open transaction.
Property cannot be changed while SQLStatement.executing is true.
%1 may not be called unless SQLResult.complete is false.
Operation is not permitted when the SQLStatement.text property is not set.
Operation is not permitted when the SQLStatement.sqlConnection property is not set.
Operation cannot be performed while SQLStatement.executing is true.
An invalid schema type was specified.
error.description: Valid values are: SQLIndexSchema SQLTableSchema SQLTriggerSchema SQLViewSchema

error.message: An invalid transaction lock type was specified.
error.description: Valid values are: SQLTransactionLockType.DEFERRED SQLTransactionLockType.IMMEDIATE SQLTransactionLockType.EXCLUSIVE

error.message: Reference specified is not of type File.
An invalid open mode was specified.
error.description: Valid values are: SQLMode.READ SQLMode.UPDATE SQLMode.CREATE

error.message: SQL Error.
An internal logic error occurred.
Access permission denied.
error.description: Indicates that the operation failed because a SQL statement attempted to perform an operation that it didn't have permission to perform, such as specifying an INSERT operation to be performed on a view.

error.message: Operation aborted.
error.description: Indicates that a SQL statement execution failed because execution was aborted. This error occurs when code in a trigger cancels the operation using the SQL RAISE() function, or if the SQLConnection.cancel() or SQLStatement.cancel() methods are called when a statement is executed using SQLStatement.execute() or SQLStatement.next() with a prefetch argument specified, and not all of the results have been returned.

error.message: Database file is currently locked.
Table is locked.
error.description: Indicates that an operation could not be completed because another AIR application was holding a lock on a table involved in the operation. This can occur when a statement executing through a SQLConnection attempts to write to a table when another SQLConnection (in the same application or a different application) has an open transaction and is writing to the table, or if a SQLConnection attempts to read from or write to a table while another SQLConnection has an exclusive-locked transaction.

error.message: Out of memory.
Attempt to write a readonly database.
error.description: Indicates that an operation could not be completed because the database is read only. This can occur if the database file is designated as read only in the operating system, if the database is opened in read-only mode, or if an older version of Adobe AIR accesses a database file created with a newer version of the runtime.

error.message: Database disk image is malformed.
error.description: Indicates that the operation failed because the specified file is a database file whose data has become corrupted. This can happen when the application is force quit while in a transaction or any other time that a database file is left in the state of having an open transaction that can't be rolled back when reopening the file.

error.message: Insertion failed because database is full.
Unable to open the database file.
error.description: Indicates that the connection could not be completed because the database file could not be opened. This can happen if SQLConnection.open() or SQLConnection.openAsync()is called with the openMode parameter set to SQLMode.UPDATE and the database file doesn't exist. It can also happen if the operating system returns an error when the runtime attempts to access the database file.

error.message: Database lock protocol error.
Database is empty.
Disk I/O error occurred.
error.description: Indicates that an operation could not be completed because of a disk I/O error. This can happen if the runtime is attempting to delete a temporary file and another program (such as a virus protection application) is holding a lock on the file. This can also happen if the runtime is attempting to write data to a file and the data can't be written.

error.message: The database schema changed.
error.description: Indicates that the operation could not be completed because of a schema error. This occurs when the schema of the database changes after a statement is prepared but before it finishes executing, such as if two SQLConnection instances are connected to the same database, and one instance changes the schema while another one is reading it.

error.message: Too much data for one row of a table.
Abort due to constraint violation.
error.description: Indicates that the operation could not be completed because the statement caused a violation of one or more data integrity constraints. These are constraints that are defined in the table structure when it is created. For more information, see the CREATE TABLE section in the appendix SQL support in local databases.

error.message: Data type mismatch.
error.description: Indicates that the operation could not be completed because of a data type mismatch error. This occurs when the data type of a value doesn't match the expected or required type. For more information, see the Data type support section in the appendix SQL support in local databases.

error.message: An internal error occurred.
Feature not supported on this operating system.
Authorization denied.
Auxiliary database format error.
An index specified for a parameter was out of range.
error.description: Indicates that the operation could not be completed because a parameter index was not valid, such as if a parameter is specified with an index less than 0, or if a parameter is specified with index 7 but the statement text only includes five parameters.

error.message: File opened is not a database file.
The page size specified was not valid for this operation.
The encryption key size specified was not valid for this operation. Keys must be exactly 16 bytes in length
The requested database configuration is not supported.
Unencrypted databases may not be reencrypted.
Cannot perform operation on closed window.
Adobe Reader cannot be found.
Adobe Reader 8.1 or later cannot be found.
Default Adobe Reader must be version 8.1 or later.
An error ocurred trying to load Adobe Reader.
Only application-sandbox content can access this feature.
Caller %1 cannot set LoaderInfo property %2.
Application-sandbox content cannot access this feature.
Attempt to access invalid clipboard.
Attempt to access dead clipboard.
The application attempted to reference a JavaScript object in a HTML page that is no longer loaded.
Drag and Drop File Promise error: %1
Cannot perform operation on a NativeProcess that is not running.
Cannot perform operation on a NativeProcess that is already running.
NativeProcessStartupInfo.executable does not specify a valid executable file.
NativeProcessStartupInfo.workingDirectory does not specify a valid directory.
Error while reading data from NativeProcess.standardOutput.
Error while reading data from NativeProcess.standardError.
Error while writing data to NativeProcess.standardInput.
The NativeProcess could not be started. '%1'
Action '%1' not allowed in current security context '%2'.
Adobe Flash Player cannot be found.
The installed version of Adobe Flash Player is too old.
DNS lookup error: platform error %1
Socket message too long
Cannot send data to a location when connected.
Cannot import a SWF file when LoaderContext.allowCodeImport is false.
Voucher is invalid.
error.description: Reacquire the voucher from the server.

error.message: User authentication failed.
error.description: Ask user to re-enter credentials.

error.message: Flash Access server does not support SSL.
error.description: SSL must be enabled on the license server when playing content packaged using Flash Media Right Management Server.

error.message: Content expired. Reacquire voucher from the server.
User authorization failed (for example, the user has not purchased the content).
error.description: The current user is not authorized to view the content.

error.message: Can't connect to the server.
error.description: Check the network connection.

error.message: Client update required (Flash Access server requires new client).
error.description: Both the runtime (Flash Player or AIR) and the Flash Access module need to be updated.

error.message: Generic internal Flash Access failure.
Wrong voucher key.
error.description: Reacquire the voucher from the server.

error.message: Video content is corrupted.
error.description: Try downloading the content again.

error.message: The AIR application or Flash Player SWF does not match the one specified in the DRM policy.
The version of the application does not match the one specified in the DRM policy.
Verification of voucher failed.
error.description: Reacquire the voucher from the server.

error.message: Write to the file system failed.
Verification of FLV/F4V header file failed.
error.description: Try downloading the DRMContentData object again. If DRMContentData was extracted from FLV/F4V try downloading the content again.

error.message: The current security context does not allow this operation.
error.description: This error can occur when the remote SWF loaded by AIR isn't allowed access to Flash Access functionality. This error can also occur if a security error occurs during network access. Other possible security errors include errors due to a crossdomain.xml file, which restricts client access based on domain, or if crossdomain.xml is not accessible.

error.message: The value of LocalConnection.isPerUser cannot be changed because it has already been locked by a call to LocalConnection.connect, .send, or .close.
Failed to load Flash Access module.
error.description: If this error occurs in AIR, reinstall AIR. If this error occurs in Flash Player, download the Flash Access module again.

error.message: Incompatible version of Flash Access module found.
error.description: If this error occurs in AIR, reinstall AIR. If this error occurs in Flash Player, download the Flash Access module again.

error.message: Missing Flash Access module API entry point.
error.description: If this error occurs in AIR, reinstall AIR. If this error occurs in Flash Player, download the Flash Access module again.

error.message: Generic internal Flash Access failure.
Individualization failed.
error.description: There was a problem with the Adobe server (e.g. could be busy). Retry the operation.

error.message: Device binding failed.
error.description: Undo any device changes or reset the license (voucher) files. The Flash Access module will then reindividualize. In AIR, voucher reset can be done by invoking the resetDRMVouchers() on DRMManager, whereas in Flash Player, the user needs to reset the license files in the Flash Player Settings Manager.

error.message: The internal stores are corrupted.
error.description: Retry the operation. If the error persists, reset the license files in the Flash Player Settings Manager. The Flash Access module will then reindividualize.

error.message: Reset license files and the client will fetch a new machine token.
error.description: Reset the license files in the Flash Player Settings Manager and the client will fetch a new machine token.

error.message: Internal stores are corrupt.
error.description: Internal stores are corrupt and has been deleted. Retry the operation.

error.message: Call customer support.
error.description: Tampering has been detected. Options are to call customer support, or reset the license files in the Flash Player Settings Manager.

error.message: Clock tampering detected.
error.description: Options are to reacquire the voucher or to fix the clock.

error.message: Server error; retry the request.
error.description: This error is a server error. Retry the request. The sub error gives the error returned by the server.

error.message: Error in application-specific namespace.
error.description: The server has returned an error in an application-specific namespace. Check the application for details.

error.message: Need to authenticate the user and reacquire the voucher.
error.description: Try authenticating the user and acquiring the voucher again.

error.message: Content is not yet valid.
error.description: The voucher is not yet valid. Try again at a later date.

error.message: Cached voucher has expired. Reacquire the voucher from the server.
error.description: The voucher cached on the local computer has expired. Reacquire the voucher from the server.

error.message: The playback window for this policy has expired.
error.description: The playback window for this policy has expired. The user can no longer play this content under this policy.

error.message: This platform is not allowed to play this content.
error.description: This platform is not allowed to play this media.

error.message: Invalid version of Flash Access module.
error.description: Upgrade AIR or Flash Access module for the Flash Player. In AIR, update to the latest version of AIR. In Flash Player, upgrade to the latest version of the Flash Access module and try playing content again.

error.message: This platform is not allowed to play this content.
error.description: This operating system is not allowed to play this media.

error.message: Upgrade Flash Player or AIR and retry playback.
error.description: Upgrade to the latest version of AIR or Flash Player, and try playing content again.

error.message: Unknown connection type.
error.description: Flash Player or AIR cannot detect the connection type. Try connecting the device to a different connection.

error.message: Can't play back on analog device. Connect to a digital device.
error.description: Cannot play media on an analog device. Connect to a digital device and try again.

error.message: Can't play back because connected analog device doesn't have the correct capabilities.
error.description: Cannot play media because the connected analog device doesn't have the correct capabilities (for example, it doesn't have Macrovision or ACP).

error.message: Can't play back on digital device.
error.description: The policy does not allow play back on digital devices.

error.message: The connected digital device doesn't have the correct capabilities.
error.description: The connected digital device doesn't have the correct capabilities, for example, it doesn't support HDCP.

error.message: Internal Error.
error.description: If this error occurs in AIR, reinstall AIR. If this error occurs in Flash Player, download the Flash Access module.

error.message: Missing Flash Access module.
error.description: If this error occurs in AIR, reinstall AIR. If this error occurs in Flash Player, download the Flash Access module.

error.message: This operation is not permitted with content protected using Flash Access.
An error occured while executing JavaScript code.
Security sandbox violation: An object with this name has already been registered from another security domain.
Security sandbox violation: Bridge caller %1 cannot access %2.
